sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"洞，穴"之意。
means: hole ： 最普通用词，泛指实体上的洞、孔或坑，不涉及其大小、深浅或穿透与否。
cave ： 指出洞、窑洞或溶洞，可以是天然的或人造的。
cavity比hole正式，指实体内中或表面的空洞或空腔。
hollow ： 通常指表面上的坑或凹处，也指物体内部的空洞。
pit ： 指天然的大洞，尤指地上的洞，也指为采掘矿物而挖的深洞。

word_mean: 凹陷：用压力造成并短时保持的凹陷
焊后在焊缝表面或焊缝背面形成的低于母材表面的局部低凹部分。

sentence.Network_en: He had to make four pit stops during the race.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不得不在比赛过程中4次停车进站。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)be extremely bad or the worst of its kind

phrase.cizu_name: the pit of one's (或 the) stomach

jx.jx_en_mean: an ill-defined region of the lower abdomen regarded as the seat of strong feelings, especially anxiety

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English pytt, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch put and German Pfütze, based on Latin puteus 'well, shaft'
mid 19th cent.: apparently from Dutch; related to pith

entry.def: A pit is a coal mine.

example.ex: It was a better community then when all the pits were working.
example.tran: 所有的煤矿都在开工的那个时候，这个社区的情况要更好一些。

entry.def: A pit is a large hole that is dug in the ground.

example.ex: Eric lost his footing and began to slide into the pit.
example.tran: 埃里克一脚踩空，开始往坑里滑。

entry.tran: （挖出沙砾或黏土后留下的）坑，窑
entry.def: A gravel pit or clay pit is a very large hole that is left where gravel or clay has been dug from the ground.

example.ex: This area of former farmland was worked as a gravel pit until 1964.
example.tran: 这块过去曾是农田的地1964年前一直被用作沙砾坑。

entry.def: If two opposing things or people are pitted against one another, they are in conflict.

example.ex: You will be pitted against people who are every bit as good as you are...
example.tran: 你将和与你势均力敌的对手展开竞争。

example.ex: This was one man pitted against the universe.
example.tran: 这是一个人挑战整个宇宙。

entry.def: In motor racing, the pits are the areas at the side of the track where drivers stop to get more fuel and to repair their cars during races.

example.ex: He moved quickly into the pits and climbed rapidly out of the car.
example.tran: 他迅速进入检修加油站，飞快地爬出赛车。

entry.def: If you describe something as the pits, you mean that it is extremely bad.

example.ex: Mary Ann asked him how dinner had been. 'The pits,' he replied.
example.tran: 玛丽·安问他晚餐怎么样，他回答说：“糟透了。”

entry.def: A pit is the stone of a fruit or vegetable.
If you pit your wits against someone, you compete with them in a test of knowledge or intelligence.

example.ex: I'd like to pit my wits against the best.
example.tran: 我希望同最优秀的对手斗智。

entry.def: If you have a feeling in the pit of your stomach, you have a tight or sick feeling in your stomach, usually because you are afraid or anxious.

example.ex: I had a funny feeling in the pit of my stomach.
example.tran: 我心头有种怪怪的感觉。

means.word_mean: 1. a sizeable hole (usually in the ground);

sentences.sentence: "they dug a pit to bury the body"

means.word_mean: 2. a concavity in a surface (especially an anatomical depression)
3. the hard inner (usually woody) layer of the pericarp of some fruits (as peaches or plums or cherries or olives) that contains the seed;

sentences.sentence: "you should remove the stones from prunes before cooking"

means.word_mean: 4. a trap in the form of a concealed hole
5. a surface excavation for extracting stone or slate;
6. lowered area in front of a stage where an orchestra accompanies the performers
7. a workplace consisting of a coal mine plus all the buildings and equipment connected with it

sentences.sentence: "let them match their best athletes against ours"
"pit a chess player against the Russian champion"
"He plays his two children off against each other"
"The skin disease scarred his face permanently"

list.explanation: 工头或领班(尤指采矿作业班长)

example.zh: 采矿作业班的头儿就是领班。

auth_sentence.res_content: The entrance is behind the Pit Stop auto shop.

sentences.cn: 他们挖了一个坑把垃圾埋掉。

sentences.en: He worked all his life down the pit.
sentences.cn: 他一辈子在矿井下工作。

means.word_mean: 使有麻子; 使有凹陷

sentences.en: Earthquake pitted the surface of the earth.
sentences.cn: 地震使地面出现了凹陷。

jushi.english: He worked all his life down the pit.
jushi.chinese: 他一辈子在矿井下工作。

jushi.english: They dug a pit to bury the rubbish.
jushi.chinese: 他们挖了一个坑把垃圾埋掉。

jushi.english: His forehead was pitted by chicken pox.
jushi.chinese: 他的前额因害了水痘而留下许多麻点。
